nodes.bodyText: the previous version was more readable

Extract getQueryRelation method commit:

the getQueryRelation -> getRelationQuery
it's not really "Extract... ", because you're also changing flow... Maybe Factor out getting query for SHOW STATS

add also a test case:
assertQueryFails("SHOW STATS FOR (SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM nation))", 
btw i think the case you have currently doesn't match the test method name -- it's more like testShowStatsWithoutTableScan

This is fishy. Rather than filter, we should verify the  the FROM is just a table.
(like we did https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/1f9088dc5757d18abf1f622f64d8bad4a87e8e2b/presto-main/src/main/java/io/prestosql/sql/rewrite/ShowStatsRewrite.java#L176-L177)
Add a test case like
STATS FOR 
  SELECT * 
  FROM nation, (subquery)

Do validation after access control in ShowStats
Validation potentially could leak information about column masks and row
filters used during the planning (done within ShowStatsRewrite).


Can we have a test covering precisely this?
should we ask AC whether there are any masks?

Use the getTableHandle(Node node, QualifiedName table) method, instead of removing it
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/1f9088dc5757d18abf1f622f64d8bad4a87e8e2b/presto-main/src/main/java/io/prestosql/sql/rewrite/ShowStatsRewrite.java#L263-L268
i think you should grab ConnectorTableMetadata instead of calling connector metadata for each column separately.

maybe add
// SHOW STATS could reveal min, max value which would be otherwise filtered out; or could reveal statistical properties of the data, like row count

This should be verified only for the columns requested.
Ie if i SHOW STATS FOR SELECT a FROM t, then mask on b doesn't matter

add

case when masked column is explicitly selected (alone, or with others)
case when masked column is not selected

commit.message:
Cleanup in ShowStatsRewrite

 - variables inline
 - variables rename
 - fix formatting
 - change visibility scope
 - static import
Factor out getting query for SHOW STATS
Disallow SHOW STATS for tables with filters and masking
